alert.note: Alert for Appomattox; Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 2:19PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Appomattox and Buckingham Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 219 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tower Hill, or 8 miles southeast of Bent Creek, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buckingham... Dillwyn... Bent Creek... New Canton... Toga... Centenary... and Sheppards. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
